channel.title: math on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in math on Some Title

item.description: I think I saw it about 10 years ago... Let’s verify this as the subject. Brute force First of all, it will be exhausted by brain death. You will have the following loop. from math import factorial for a in range(1,100): for b in range(1,a): for c in range(1,100): if (a-b)%c != 0: continue d = int((a-b)/c) if a-b/c == factorial(d): print("{}-{}/{}={}!".format(a,b,c,d)) Output. 2-1/1=1! 3-1/1=2! 3-2/1=1! 4-2/1=2! 4-3/1=1! 5-3/1=2! 5-4/1=1!

item.title: Math memorandum #3 to keep up with the scene
item.description: ## Set again this time In the third lesson, we will perform permutations and combinations of sets. Is it useful when making a matrix in a program? Number of cases When you roll the dice, the number of rolls is 6, and if you make a coin toss, the number of sides In two ways, the number that can occur like this is called the number of cases __.
